content: Yutong Xie - MBZUAI MBZUAI About About Leadership and Governance Alumni Mission Faculty Directory Fast Facts Office of the President Office of the Provost Study Study Graduate Admission Process Undergraduate Admission Process Faculty Directory Aspire Ph.D. Fellowship Program Master in Applied Artificial Intelligence (MAAI) Masterâ€™s Programs Ph.D. Programs Undergraduate Program Undergraduate Research Internship Program University Catalogue Research Research Computer Vision Research Machine Learning Research Natural Language Processing Projects Research Centers Innovate Innovate Consulting Incubation and Entrepreneurship Center Institute of Digital Public Health Institute of Foundation Models Office of Public Affairs and Alumni Relations Partnerships and Collaborations Training Programs Student Resources Undergraduate Academic Calendar Graduate Academic Calendar Campus Facilities Career Services and Internships Publications Repository Educational Affairs Library Portal Office of the Registrar Campus Map News & Events Commencement Events Media Center The Node | Stories of MBZUAI MBZUAI Nexus | The Global AI Research & Knowledge Network Apply now Home / Faculty directory / Yutong Xie Yutong Xie Assistant Professor of Computer Vision Research Interests Dr. Yutong's research primarily focuses on computer vision and machine learning for healthcare sector, aiming to develop intelligent solutions to assist healthcare professionals in anatomical structure segmentation, disease diagnosis, prognosis, and therapy, particularly in the context of medical data analysis with limited annotations. Share Prior to joining MBZUAI, Dr. Xie was a Research Fellow at the University of Adelaide (UoA), and a member of the Australian Institute for Machine Learning (AIML). She has published more than 50 peer-reviewed publications, most in flagship journals/conference proceedings including IEEE-TPAMI/TMI/TIP, IJCV, Medical Image Analysis, IEEE-TCSVT, MICCAI, CVPR, ECCV, IJCAI, ACCV. Her research has attracted over 5,000 Google citations. Dr. Xie received the Outstanding Doctoral Dissertation Award and the CVPR 2024 DEI Grants. She serves as an Area Chair of MICCAI 2023/2024/2025. She is also a reviewer of flagship journals/conference proceedings (e.g., IEEE-TPAMI/TMI/TIP, MedIA, NeurIPS, ICLR, CVPR, ICCV, ECCV, MICCAI, and AAAI) and has received the Distinguished Reviewer Certificate from IEEE-TMI and CVPR 2023. Research Fellow, Australian Institute for Machine Learning, University of Adelaide, Australia. 2022-2024, Top 2% Scientists Worldwide, Stanford University 2024, CVPR 2024 DEI grants 2023, Distinguished Reviewer of IEEE-TMI 2023, Outstanding Reviewer of CVPR 2023 Xie Y, Zhang J, Xia Y, et al. UniMiSS+: Universal Medical Self-Supervised Learning From Cross-Dimensional Unpaired Data[J]. IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, 2024. Xie Y, Chen Q, Wang S, et al. PairAug: What Can Augmented Image-Text Pairs Do for Radiology?[C]//Proceedings of the IEEE/CVF Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition. 2024: 11652-11661. Xie Y, Gu L, Harada T, et al. Rethinking masked image modelling for medical image representation[J]. Medical Image Analysis, 2024, 98: 103304. Xie Y, Zhang J, Liu L, et al. ReFs: A hybrid pre-training paradigm for 3D medical image segmentation[J]. Medical Image Analysis, 2024, 91: 103023. Xie Y, Zhang J, Xia Y, et al. Learning from partially labeled data for multi-organ and tumor segmentation[J]. IEEE Transactions on Pattern Analysis and Machine Intelligence, 2023.
